$comment: This file was automatically generated, do not modify it by hand. Instead, modify the source Typescript file, and run `pnpm types build:catalog-schemas`.
title: Catalog plugin item
description: Data model of a Catalog plugin item

componentsIds.description: List of source component ids of the services in the item's resources

imageUrl.description: Url of the image associated with the item

isLatest.description: Flag stating if the the current document is the latest version of the item

itemId.description: RFC-1035 compliant identifier of the item. It forms a composite PK with tenantId and, if present, version.name

providerId.description: Identifier of the provider used to retrieve markdown documentation content and external resources, if supported by the item type

publishOnMiaDocumentation.description: Flag stating if the resource documentation should be published on Mia-Platform public documentation

releaseDate.description: Creation date of this item's release

repositoryUrl.description: URL of the repository containing the source code of the resource created by the item

name.description: The variable name (generally, a key written in UPPER_SNAKE_CASE)

description.description: A brief description of the variable

managedBy.description: A string that represents the Console section that manages the variable. It only works used in combination with the `readOnly` property set to `true`

readOnly.description: A boolean that represents if you can change the value of the variable through the Console

value.description: The variable default value. It can contain placeholders that will be replaced with the actual values when the service is created

defaultProbes.description: The readiness, liveness, and startup paths of the service. By modifying the map of the probes, you can overwrite the default paths applied by the Console

defaultResources.description: CPU and memory limitations of the service, which can be used to overwrite the default limitations imposed by the Console for these parameters

defaultAnnotations.description: The service annotations, which can be used to provide additional information about your services for various purposes. Annotations starting with `mia-platform.eu` are reserved

defaultConfigMaps.description: The default ConfigMaps, if any, that will be mounted inside the container of the microservice

defaultEnvironmentVariables.description: The environment variables that will overwrite the default environment variables applied by the Console

fieldPath.description: The field path of the Downward API that contains the value of the variable

name.description: The variable name (generally, a key written in UPPER_SNAKE_CASE)

description.description: A brief description of the variable

managedBy.description: A string that represents the Console section that manages the variable. It only works used in combination with the `readOnly` property set to `true`

readOnly.description: A boolean that represents if you can change the value of the variable through the Console

containerName.description: The name of the container where the field is located

defaultLabels.description: The service labels, which can be used to categorize, group, and select your service. Labels starting with "mia-platform.eu" are reserved

defaultProbes.description: The readiness, liveness, and startup paths of the service. By modifying the map of the probes, you can overwrite the default paths applied by the Console

defaultResources.description: CPU and memory limitations of the service, which can be used to overwrite the default limitations imposed by the Console for these parameters

defaultSecrets.description: The default secrets, if any, to be mounted inside the container of the microservice

links.description: Custom links to other Console pages

enableIf.description: The name of a feature toggle to be used to optionally display the link

hidePrefix.description: Flag stating if the `label` should not be prefixed by a "View" copy

label.description: The label to be shown in the link button. It does not support internationalization. Unless property `hidePrefix` is set to `false`, the label will be shown right next to a "View" copy

targetSection.description: The name of the registered microfrontend where the link should land

supportedBy.description: Identifier of the company that has produced the item

supportedByImageUrl.description: Url of the image associated with the company that has produced the item

tenantId.description: Identifier of the tenant to which the item belongs. It forms a composite PK with itemId and, if present, version.name

itemTypeDefinitionRef.description: URN of the Item Type Definition describing the item. It must be in the format `urn:<itd.metadata.namespace.id>:sc:itd:<itd.metadata.name>`

version.description: Version of the item following semver

security.description: Flag stating if the version addresses any vulnerability

allTenants.description: If true, the item will be accessible to all companies

public.description: If true, the item will be accessible from any user that access the Console, even if not authenticated
